utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, a definitely not gay musician sleeping on my girlfriend’s couch. Yippee.

utterance.content: Okay, we went out a little bit, a long time ago, but we were never like going out.

utterance.content: Okay, not to be pedantic, but the last I checked went out was in fact the past tense of going out, which I think we all know is a popular euphemism for saw each other naked.

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: An old boyfriend who’s definitely not gay. That’s what a guy likes to hear, definitely.

utterance.content: All right, I’ll start with an easy one, um, Isaac Newton, Madame Curie and Niels Bohr.

utterance.content: Leonard! Stop the car!

utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: Come on, come on, we’re late.

utterance.content: Yes, you can.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So what did Justin say when you told him he couldn’t sleep on your couch?
